Amid the changes of this earthly life.

From stage to stage on life’s unfolding way
Bring to their mind the vows they make this day,
Your Spirit be their Guide in every move,
Their faith in Christ the basis of their love.

data.first_line: O God from whom mankind derives its name
data.author: Fred H. Kaan

data.title: Heavenly Father, Hear Our Prayer

stanzas.text:
Heav’nly Father, hear our prayer
As we bow before You:
Bless them in the life they share,
Humble we implore You.
Be their guide in all endeavors,
Be their hope that nothing severs;
Constant source of love divine,
Let Your love within them shine!

As they pledge their love this day
Here before Your altar,
May their hearts,, upon You stayed,
Never fail or falter.
Be their comfort in all sorrow;
Be their reason for tomorrow.
Grant them strength to live each hour
Trusting solely in Your pow’r.

Blest Creator, Lord of life,
Hear our glad thanksgiving.
Husband You have joined to wife
For their earthly living.
Justified by Jesus’ merit,
Life eternal they inherit.
When their days on earth have passed,
Take them to Your home at last!

data.author: Barbara E. Adam
data.first_line: Heav'nly Father, hear our prayer As we bow before You

data.title: May the Grace of Christ Our Savior

stanzas.text:
May the grace of Christ our Savior
And the Father’s boundless love,
With the Holy Spirit’s favor,
Rest upon them from above.

Thus may they abide in union
With each other and the Lord,
And possess, in sweet communion,
Joys which earth cannot afford.

data.filename: 659 - May the Grace of Christ Our Savior.mp3
data.first_line: May the grace of Christ our Savior
data.author: John Newton

data.title: Glory Be to the Father

stanzas.text:
and to the Son,
and to the Holy Ghost;
As it was in the beginning,
is now, and ever shall be,
world without end.
Amen, Amen.

data.author: Anonymous
data.first_line: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son

data.title: Holy, Holy, Holy

stanzas.text:
Holy, holy, holy, Holy is the Lord!
Holy, holy, holy, Holy is our God!
He who always liveth, Evermore the same
Heav’n and earth He ruleth, Come and praise His name!

Holy, holy, holy, Holy is the Lord!
Holy, holy, holy, Holy is our God!
Glorious adn beloved Is the One adored!
Holy, holy, holy, Holy is the Lord.

data.first_line: Holy, holy, holy, Holy is the Lord!
data.author: John Philipp Neumann

data.title: Let All Mortal Flesh Keep Silence

stanzas.text:
And with fear and trembling stand;
Ponder nothing earthly-minded,
For with blessing in his hand,
Christ our God to earth descendeth,
Our full homage to demand. Amen.

data.filename: 662 - Let All Mortal Flesh Keep Silence.mp3
data.first_line: Let all mortal flesh keep silence

stanzas.text: A-men, A—men.
A—–men.
A—men.
A—men, (A-men.)
A—–men.
A-men, A-men, A—men.

data.title: Sevenfold Amen

stanzas.text:
A-men,
A—men,
A—–men,
A—–men,
A—–men,
A-men.

data.first_line: Amen, Amen, Amen, Amen, Amen, Amen, Amen

data.title: All Things Come of Thee

stanzas.text:
and of thine own have we given thee.
Amen.

data.author: Anonymous
data.first_line: All things come of Thee, O Lord

data.title: Cast Thy Burden Upon the Lord
data.filename: 666 - Cast Thy Burden Upon the Lord.mp3
data.first_line: Cast thy burden upon the Lord, And He shall sustain thee

data.title: Lord, Bless Thy Word to Every Heart

stanzas.text:
In this Thy house today,
And help us each as now we part,
Its precepts to obey.
Amen
Amen

data.filename: 667 - Lord, Bless Thy Word to Every Heart.mp3
data.first_line: Lord, bless Thy word to every heart
data.author: Pearl Waggnoer Howard

data.title: O Thou Who Hearest
data.author: Frederick A. Jackson
data.first_line: O Thou who hearest every heartfelt prayer

data.title: The Lord Bless You and Keep You

stanzas.text:
the Lord life His countenance upon you,
and give you peace;
the Lord make His face to shine upon you,
and be gracious unto you,
be gracious,
the Lord be gracious unto you.
Amen.

data.filename: 669 - The Lord Bless You and Keep You.mp3
data.first_line: The Lord bless you and keep you; The Lord lift

data.title: We Give Thee But Thine Own
data.filename: 670 - We Give Thee But Thine Own.mp3
data.first_line: We give Thee but Thine own, Whate'er the gift may be
data.author: William Walsham How

data.title: Now, Dear Lord, As We Pray

stanzas.text:
Now, dear Lord, as we pray,
take our hearts and minds far away
from the press of the world all around
to your throne where grace does abound.
May our lives be transformed by Your love,
may our souls be refreshed from above.
At this moment, let people everywhere
join us now as we come to You in prayer.

data.filename: 671 - Now, Dear Lord, As We Pray.mp3
data.author: Ralph Carmichael
data.first_line: Now, Dear Lord, as we pray, take our hearts and minds far away

data.title: Spirit of the Living God

stanzas.text:
Fall afresh on me!
Spirit of the living God,
Fall afresh on me!
Break me, melt me, mold me, fill me!
Spirit of the living God,
Fall afresh on me!

data.first_line: Spirit of the living God, Fall afresh on me!
data.author: Daniel Iverson

data.title: May God Be With You

stanzas.text:
May God be with you, Keep you safe till then;
And may His blessings Be within your heart,
May God be with you While we’re apart,
May God be with you.

May God be with you, Watch you from above,
May God protect you in His tender love;
And with the dawning Of each bright, new day,
May God be with you, To guide your way,
May God be with you.

data.first_line: May God be with you Till we meet again
data.author: Anonymous

data.title: Shalom

stanzas.text:
shalom, good friends,
shalom, shalom.
Till we meet again,
till we meet again,
shalom, shalom.

data.first_line: Shalom, my friends, shalom my friends
data.author: Wayne Hooper

data.title: May the Lord Bless and Keep You

stanzas.text:
both now and evermore.
Amen, Amen.

data.filename: 675 - May the Lord Bless and Keep You.mp3
data.first_line: May the Lord bless and keep you
data.author: Melvin West

data.title: Thy Word Is a Lantern

stanzas.text: And a light unto my path.

data.first_line: Thy Word is a lantern unto my feet

data.title: Heavenly Father, to Thee We Pray
data.filename: 677 - Heavenly Father, to Thee We Pray.mp3
data.first_line: Heavenly Father, to Thee we pray, On this holy Sabbath day
data.author: John Read

data.title: God Be in My Head
data.first_line: God be in my head, and in my understanding

data.title: God Be in My Head

stanzas.text:
And in my thinking.
god be in my eyes,
And in my looking.
God be in my mouth
And in my speaking.
Oh, God be in my hear,
And in my understanding.

data.first_line: God be in my head, And in my thinking

data.title: Holy Spirit, Hear Us

stanzas.text:
Holy Spirit, prompt us
When we kneel to pray;
Nearer come, and teach us
What we ought to say.

Holy Spirit, shine Thou
On the Book we read;
Gild it’s holy pages
With the light we need.

data.first_line: Holy Spirit, hear us; Help us while we sing
data.author: William H. Parker

data.title: This Is the Day the Lord Hath Made

stanzas.text:
he calls the hours his own.
Let heaven rejoice, let earth be glad,
and praise surround the throne.

data.filename: 681 - This Is the Day the Lord Hath Made.mp3
data.first_line: This is the day the Lord hath made; He calls the hours His own
data.author: Isaac Watts

data.title: As You Have Promised, Lord

stanzas.text:
You are letting Your servant go away in peace.
May eyes have seen You in broad daylight
before all nations, planning salvation.
Light of revelation for the nations,
and glory of Your people Israel.

data.author: F.L. Battles
data.first_line: As You have promised, Lord, today

data.title: Jesus, Stand Among Us

stanzas.text:
Jesus, stand among us
In Thy risen power;
Let this time of worship
Be a hallowed hour.

Breathe the Holy Spirit
Into every heart;
Bid the fears and sorrows
From each soul depart.

Thus with quickened footsteps
We pursue our way,
Watching for the dawning
Of eternal day.

data.first_line: Jesus, stand among us In Thy risen power
data.author: William Pennefather

data.title: Hear Our Prayer, O Lord

stanzas.text:
Hear our prayer, O Lord;
Incline Thine ear to us,
And grant us Thy peace.
Amen.

data.author: Anonymous
data.first_line: Hear our prayer, O Lord, Hear our prayer, O Lord

data.title: Cause Me to Hear

stanzas.text:
for in Thee do I trust.
Cause me to know they way where-in I shall walk
for I lift up my soul to Thee.
Amen

data.first_line: Cause me to hear Thy lovingkindness in the morning

data.title: Bless Thou the Gifts

stanzas.text:
bless thou the work our hearts have planned.
Ours is the faith, the will, the thought;
the rest, O God, is in thy hand.
Amen.

data.first_line: Bless Thou the gifts our hands have brought
data.author: Samuel Longfellow

data.title: The Lord Is in His Holy Temple

stanzas.text:
The Lord is in His holy temple,
Let all the earth be silent
be silent before Him.

data.filename: 687 - The Lord Is in His Holy Temple.mp3
data.author: Anonymous
data.first_line: The Lord is in His holy temple

data.title: Surely, Surely

stanzas.text:
Surely angels still linger near;
I hear music soft on my ear,
I feel His Spirit,
I have no fear.

data.first_line: Surely, surely the Lord has been here
data.author: Eleanor Wright

data.title: Day by Day, Dear Lord

stanzas.text:
To see Thee more clearly, Love Thee more dearly,
Follow Thee more nearly, Day by day.

data.first_line: Day by day, Dear Lord, of Thee three things I pray
data.author: Richard of Chichester

data.title: Dismiss Us, Lord With Blessing
data.first_line: Dismiss us, Lord, with blessing, we pray
data.author: L. E. Froom

data.title: Lead Me, Lord

stanzas.text: make thy way plain before my face.
that makest me dwell in safety.

data.first_line: Lead me, Lord, lead me in Thy righteousness

data.title: The Lord Is in His Holy Temple

stanzas.text:
The Lord is in His holy temple,
Let all the earth keep silence,
Let all the earth keep silence, before Him,
Keep silence, keep silence, before Him.
Amen.

data.filename: 692 - The Lord Is in His Holy Temple.mp3
data.first_line: The Lord is in His holy temple

data.title: Almighty Father

stanzas.text:
and bless all souls that wait before Thee.
Amen.

data.author: Anonymous
data.first_line: Almighty Father, hear our prayer, and bless all souls
